column4: I intend to install Ubuntu Server 6.06 when it will come out. Currently my VPS provider offers me to preinstall either Ubuntu 5.04 or Debian Sarge. Which one will provide a smoother dist-upgrade process?
Ubuntu 5.04, but you will need to first upgrade it to 5.10, then 6.06.
aren't there any significant differences between the server editon and the normal edition? The 5.04 didn't have a server edition.

Ooh.  I forgot about that.  Still though, the packages will be compatible, and you can remove all the parts you don't need.  So, it will be slightly more hassle for you than non-server people, but still wiser to use Ubuntu to start than Debian.
